column5: We will be heading up to Wabaskang the last week of July and staying at Kingfisher. Has anyone been there lately? Any info as to what's happening there would be appreciated. Info; like what and where. We've been there a couple of times before but not with the new owners.

[font color=green size=3][b]I understand the recent rains have raised the lake back to "normal". Early the walleye were scattered on the flats. I'll be up there again before you are, so I'll post when I return. Wish'in I was fish'in on Wabby
Thanks for the info. I'll appreciate the update. We are hoping to get into the Jumbo Perch again this time..Some up around the 14 inch mark last time. great time for the kids. Grandpa too. :)

I'm taking the family to Sleepy Dog the week of 07/08. This is my first time to Wabaskang. I picked this lake and resort from reading the messages in this forum. Like you, any addtional info would be appreciated and I will post results when we get back.

We are heading up July 21 staying at Sleepy Dog. Looking for any current info, suggestions. We went up about the same time last year and did good on walleyes, no great size. Caught some northerns and perch but hope to do better this year. Thanks

We are heading up July 21 staying at Sleepy Dog. Looking for any current info, suggestions. We went up about the same time last year and did good on walleyes, no great size. Caught some northerns and perch but hope to do better this year. Thanks

I too am going to Wabaskang in the middle of August. Each week I go towww.peffleyscamp.com which is a resort at the north end of the lake. Each week he posts a fishing report. Gets you pumped up about going. Each Sunday/Monday a new report posts from the previous weeks fishing. Although would like reports from guys who have actually been up there this summer. Wildernessgum

Just wondering if anybody that has stayed on Wabaskang has traveled back to Wine lake this year? If you have how was the fishing? Scott
